make the site a WebVR site using A-Fram, and use the same image as the skybox
Make sure everything is kept in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

To create a WebVR site using A-Frame with the specified image as a skybox, you can use the following HTML code. This code embeds A-Frame library, and the image will be used as the sky. You can copy and paste this code into an HTML file: ```html WebVR A-Frame App

A-Frame WebVR Example

Look around and explore!

``` ### Instructions: 1. Copy the above code. 2. Open a text editor (like Notepad, Sublime Text, or Visual Studio Code). 3. Paste the copied code into the editor. 4. Save the file with an `.html` extension, such as `index.html`. 5. Open the saved file in a web browser (preferably one that supports WebVR like Chrome or Firefox) to see the A-Frame scene in action. ### Features: - The image is used as the skybox in the A-Frame scene. - A 3D box entity that bobs up and down is added for visual interest. - A text entity welcomes users to the VR environment. - An overlay with a button is placed on the screen to trigger a JavaScript alert when clicked. ### Note: To experience the full VR capabilities, you will need to use a VR headset compatible with WebVR (e.g., Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, etc.) and a compatible browser. If you are using a regular browser, you can still interact with the VR scene by clicking and moving around.

However, you can also interact with the scene using a regular mouse or device in a compatible browser. Enjoy exploring your VR world!
